question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: update_file_store_metadata_with_timeout()] [Version rollback attack] Can providing a version parameter lower than the current metadata version cause a rollback that enables double-spending or transaction replay attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: update_file_store_metadata_with_timeout()] [Mutable reference race] Can the &mut self parameter create race conditions when multiple threads attempt to update metadata simultaneously, causing data corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: update_file_store_metadata_internal()] [Version manipulation] Can an attacker call this internal method with arbitrary version values to rewrite transaction history or create inconsistent metadata states? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: update_file_store_metadata_internal()] [Chain ID spoofing] Can providing incorrect chain_id values in update_file_store_metadata_internal() cause the indexer to mix transactions from different chains, enabling cross-chain replay attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: update_file_store_metadata_internal()] [Atomicity violation] Is the metadata update atomic, or can partial writes during crashes leave the file store in an inconsistent state requiring manual recovery? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: update_file_store_metadata_internal()] [Concurrent update corruption] Can concurrent calls to update_file_store_metadata_internal() from different operators cause metadata corruption through write conflicts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: upload_transaction_batch()] [Batch size validation] Does upload_transaction_batch() properly validate that the batch contains exactly FILE_ENTRY_TRANSACTION_COUNT transactions, or can oversized batches corrupt storage? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: upload_transaction_batch()] [Version sequence validation] Can transactions with non-sequential version numbers be uploaded in a batch, causing gaps or overlaps in transaction history? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: upload_transaction_batch()] [Transaction signature bypass] Does upload_transaction_batch() verify transaction signatures and validity before upload, or can invalid/malicious transactions be permanently stored? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: upload_transaction_batch()] [Version overflow] Can uploading batches with version numbers that when added cause u64 overflow create wraparound conditions that corrupt the transaction ordering? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: upload_transaction_batch()] [Duplicate upload] Can the same transaction batch be uploaded multiple times with different chain_id values, causing state inconsistencies or double-counting? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: upload_transaction_batch()] [Return value manipulation] Can malicious implementations return incorrect (start_version, end_version) tuples to trick callers about what was actually uploaded? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_latest_version()] [Stale version] Can get_latest_version() at lines 110-113 return stale metadata.version due to caching issues, causing indexers to miss new transactions or reprocess old ones? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_latest_version()] [None handling] When get_file_store_metadata() returns None at line 111, can dependent code incorrectly handle the Option::None case leading to panics or serving incorrect version 0? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_latest_version()] [Version rollback] Can metadata corruption or storage issues cause get_latest_version() to return a lower version than previously seen, enabling transaction replay attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: get_latest_version()] [Race condition] Can concurrent metadata updates cause get_latest_version() to return inconsistent values to different callers, causing transaction ordering conflicts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: clone_box()] [State isolation] Can cloned FileStoreOperator instances share mutable state that causes race conditions when both instances modify metadata or upload transactions simultaneously? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: clone_box()] [Resource exhaustion] Can unlimited cloning of FileStoreOperator instances exhaust file descriptors, network connections, or memory resources causing DoS? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: clone_box()] [Metadata timestamp] Does cloning preserve the file_store_metadata_last_updated timestamp, or can clones bypass timeout protections in update_file_store_metadata_with_timeout()? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: storage_format()] [Format confusion] Can implementations return different StorageFormat values over time, causing transactions encoded in one format to be decoded with another, leading to data corruption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Function: storage_format()] [Compression bypass] Can attackers exploit differences between Lz4CompressedProto and JsonBase64UncompressedProto formats to inject malicious data that passes validation in one format but exploits vulnerabilities in another? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Cross-method attack] Can calling get_transactions() with a version that doesn't exist followed by upload_transaction_batch() for that version create race conditions that corrupt transaction ordering? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Cross-method attack] Can rapidly alternating between update_file_store_metadata_with_timeout() and get_file_store_metadata() create metadata inconsistencies that break transaction retrieval? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Cross-method attack] Can uploading transactions with upload_transaction_batch() while simultaneously calling get_transactions() for the same version cause reads of partially written data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/file_store_operator/mod.rs] [Cross-method attack] Can clone_box() followed by concurrent metadata updates from both the original and cloned instances cause metadata write conflicts and version corruption? (High)
